reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Radisson for one night and paid $89 by booking directly with the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Accommodations

reviews.text: The room appeared to be newly renovated. The carpet, furnishings, decor, etc., was well designed, spotless and very comfortable. They even had the Sleep Number bed which was fun to play with.
reviews.title: The best business traveler's hotel in Jax with class and style!

likes.liked: — The fabulous pool, relaxing bar scene, comfy bed, dark and warm decor
likes.disliked: — just a small stain on the bench at the foot of my bed, and there's only 1 set of laundry machines for the guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitley recommed this hotel to anyone looking for superior accommodations at an affordable price.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Good solid hotel
reviews.text: I really like the decor of this hotel, the lobby and the rooms. Staff is professional. The bar is small but has 2 big screen tvs, so you can sip on your drink and be entertained if you're by yourself (as I frequently am, travelling alone). The lady bartender who works there M-W is sweet as can be, and even made everyone a shooter at the end of the night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has adequate seating with a lounger and chaise, as well as a really nice desk. Internet is free and there was a fridge in my room, hidden by wooden paneling. I have to say again, that I loved the decor. Dark wood, paneling at the bed's headboard, earthy and rich brown tones. The bed was very comfortable as well.
reviews.title: No problems here! Loved The Radisson!

likes.liked: — The Decor was updated and fresh

reviews.text: I stayed at the Radisson for two nights for business. The hotel was great. The staff were nice. The only item that I didn't care for was the Sleep Number bed. This was the first one I had slept on and I have concluded that I prefer a less complex bed. Marriott beds are much better in my opinion. Overall, the hotel is great!
reviews.title: Great hotel... didn't care for Sleep Number bed

reviews.text: This is my favorite hotel in the area...brand new and in a good central location. PLUSH beyond belief bed and beddings & attention to detail is a priority.Considering the value, this is better than a 4 star location. I would definitely return, as this is a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Choice
Sleep Number beds not for everyone
reviews.text: I definitely don't think that the Radisson is anywhere near luxury. Don't get me wrong, this place is decorated like a luxury hotel. The lobby and rooms look very nice, but appearances can be deceiving. Our room never got below about 75 degrees. We literally ran the AC wide open for 24 hours and the room was still hot. The room had a refridgerator that didn't hardly work. We left some cokes in it for 24 hours and they were still luke warm. Also, our sheets were not changed and our beds weren't made up. And you have to put all of your towels in the tub before you leave or they won't change your towels. Also the water pressure was awful. There was barely any water pressure and the drain took a long time.

The worst part of our stay was the beds. One of our sleep number beds was broken the first night. It was like sleeping on the pavement. The other bed worked, but we just did not like the sleep number beds. It is apparent from reading these reviews that some people like them, but they are not for everyone.
reviews.title: wonderful
